plugins.name: Color Shades Generator
plugins.description:
A simple Figma plugin that helps you generate beautiful color palettes with customizable shades. Perfect for creating consistent color systems as it will generate Styles and/or Variables.


Features


Color Generation


Generate 11 shades (50, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 950) from a single base color

Two generation methods:

-- HSL Adjustments: Fine-tune lightness and saturation for each shade

-- LAB Interpolation: Create perceptually uniform color scales


Color Control

- Input base color using a color picker or HSL values

- Customize color name for your palette

- Real-time preview of all generated shades

- Adjust individual shade properties (lightness and saturation)

- Adjust contrast between each shade


Figma Integration

- Generate Figma Color Styles

- Generate Figma Color Variables

- Visual preview of the palette

- Automatic positioning of generated palettes


Code snippets:

Copy-paste ready code snippets:

- CSS variables

- Tailwind CSS

- Hex values

- HSL values


How to Use


1. Name your color palette

2. Select your base color (500 shade) using the color picker or HSL inputs

3. Choose your preferred generation method (HSL Adjustments or LAB Interpolation)

4. Customize individual shade adjustments if using HSL method or use contrast slider

6. Choose whether to generate Figma Color Styles and Variables

7. Click "Generate Palette" to create your color system
plugins.tagline: A simple Figma plugin that helps you generate beautiful color palettes with customizable shades.

plugins.name: Flutter Color Variables
plugins.description:
Simple plugin that generates Flutter/Dart Color constants from your Figma color variables.


Example Export:

import 'dart:ui';

enum ColorsMode {
lightMode,
darkMode
}

class Colors {
// Single-value colors
static Color primaryColor = const Color(0xFF000000);

// Mode-dependent colors
static Color backgroundColor(ColorsMode mode) {
switch (mode) {
case ColorsMode.lightMode:
return const Color(0xFFFFFFFF);
case ColorsMode.darkMode:
return const Color(0xFF000000);
}
}
}
plugins.tagline: Generate Flutter/Dart code for your color variables

plugins.name: in any case
plugins.description:
From effortless case changes to instant text metrics, this plugin integrates perfectly with both Figma and FigJam, adapting to your workflow and style. Simplify your design process and keep your text consistent, no matter the case!


Apply the most popular case transformations with ease, including Title Case, Sentence case, UPPERCASE, lowercase, tOOGLE cASE, camelCase, kebab-case, snake_case, PascalCase, and flatcase. Easily convert the case of text across multiple layers, components, and instances at once, with maintaining your font styles and formatting while making those changes.


  1. Access case conversion and text stats instantly through the actions menu, speeding up your workflow. Simply use Cmd + / on Mac or Ctrl + / on Win
  2. View character, word, sentence, and paragraphs counts, which dynamically update as you type or select text
  3. See the results of your case changes immediately
  4. Enjoy full functionality in both Figma and FigJam
  5. Continue working in your preferrable Dark or Light modes with native Figma colors
  6. Rest assured that your data is safe – this plugin doesn’t store or send any of your text or design data
plugins.tagline: Instant case conversion and text metrics

plugins.name: TokenKebab Converter
plugins.description:
Purpose

This Figma plugin is designed to facilitate a smoother transition between design and development stages, particularly for those utilizing the Tokens Studio and EightShapes in their design system workflow.

Key Functionality

  • Typography Token Transformation:
  • Converts typography tokens defined in dot notation (e.g., typography.Body.Bold) into an appropriate Sass mixin structure (e.g., @include fontStyle(body-bold);).
  • Kebab-Case Conversion:
  • Transforms tokens, including those related to spacing (e.g., spacing.150), into a kebab-case format, ensuring consistency and CSS-friendly naming conventions (e.g., spacing-150).
  • Theme Prefixing:
  • Automatically prefixes theme-related tokens with "light-", changing, for instance, theme.input.border.default to light-theme-input-border-default.

In essence, the plugin programmatically refactors design tokens, enhancing their usability and implementability in CSS/Sass codebases, and ensuring a coherent and systematic naming convention throughout the design-to-development handoff process.
plugins.tagline: Ensuring Consistency from Design Tokens to Implementation

plugins.name: Designlens
plugins.description:
DesignLens is your AI design assistant — built right inside Figma.

Get instant, actionable feedback on your designs so you can iterate faster, ship smarter, and design with confidence.


Design reviews are often slow, inconsistent, and filled with vague feedback like “make it cleaner” or “this doesn’t feel right.” You’re left guessing what to fix — or worse, waiting days just to hear back.

DesignLens fixes that. With just a click inside Figma, DesignLens analyzes your screen and gives you detailed feedback — instantly.


⚙️ How it works:

1. Select any frame in Figma

2. Run the DesignLens plugin

3. Get clear, structured feedback in seconds



🔍 What it does:


1. UI/Visual Analysis

Get insights on layout, hierarchy, accessibility, consistency, and overall clarity.

We don’t just point out issues — we tell you what’s working, what needs fixing, and how to fix it.


2. Heuristic Evaluation

Your design is evaluated against proven usability principles (like error prevention, recognition over recall, and user control) — helping you catch friction points before users do.


👀 Coming soon:

- UX flow-level analysis

- Business goal alignment


We're just getting started.


📬 Feedback or questions?

Reach us anytime at trydesignlens@gmail.com

EmojiAI is the ultimate tool for creating custom, AI-generated emojis that express you. 🎨✨ Whether you’re looking for something cute, funny, or unique, EmojiAI makes it easy to design and collect personalized emojis for any mood or moment.


🎁 Start with 10 free tokens!

New users get 10 free tokens to generate their first custom emojis. Use them to create unique designs and start building your very own emoji gallery.


💡 What EmojiAI does:

EmojiAI uses advanced AI to craft emojis tailored to your preferences. Each creation is saved to your personal emoji gallery, so you can keep, organize, and share your custom designs anytime.


⚙️ Features:

  1. AI-Generated Emojis: Let AI bring your ideas to life with custom emoji designs.
  2. Personal Emoji Gallery: Store and manage all your creations in one place.
  3. Creative Customization: Generate emojis that match your mood, personality, or style.
  4. Fun and Intuitive: Effortless for everyone, from casual users to emoji enthusiasts!


📝 How it works:

  1. Use your free tokens to generate AI-powered emojis.
  2. Save and organize your creations in your emoji gallery.
  3. Share your custom emojis with friends or simply enjoy them for yourself!


Start creating today with EmojiAI – the easiest way to design and collect personalized emojis. Your emoji gallery is waiting! 🎉
plugins.tagline: Make Your Own Emoji with the Power of AI!

plugins.name: ZapCode
plugins.description:
Ever dreamed of turning your Figma designs into glorious, ultra-responsive code with just a couple of clicks? Well, dream no more, friend—this plugin is your magic wand!


Here’s the game plan:


  1. Select your Figma layer: Want the entire page? Click it. Only need a nifty component? Select it.
  2. Press the “Zap-it” Button: Sit back, sip your coffee, and let our AI do its super-brainy thing.
  3. Download your freshly minted code: HTML, CSS, Angular, and more! Plus, assets are included.
  4. Name your components: Enter your preferred component names, and we’ll use them to create files tailored to your needs.
  5. Success! You just dodged hours of hand-coding. Cue confetti!


New Features You’ll Love:


Angular Tech Stack: Now supporting Angular with advanced settings to fit your specific needs.


Tailwind & Bootstrap Support: For HTML/CSS conversion, you can now choose between Tailwind and Bootstrap frameworks.


Custom Component Naming: Add a personal touch to your files by naming components as per your preference.


Oh, and don’t forget:


  1. Every day, you’ll get 5 free Zapcoins for your code generation adventures. Need more? You can now buy Zapcoins directly within the plugin via Buy Me a Coffee.
  2. Redeem Zapcoins with tokens sent to your email and unlock premium features.
  3. First, click the “API Key” button to feed our AI (we use Anthropic’s API)—your key is stored securely in Figma's storage. Converted files are also saved there for safekeeping. No shady external servers, promise!
  4. No need to enter API key while using free Zapcoins, Gemini will be used to convert your designs.


Now go forth, fearless designer, and code all the things…without actually writing code. Because that’s how we roll! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Go Design To Code with One Click.

plugins.name: E3 Variant Finder
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin we developed for collaboration in our team. It allows programmers to find the required instance by provided component name and instance name.


Application area: it allows to simplify communication between programmer and designer, if you need to change not all instances of a component, but only one of them.


  1. The designer sends the programmer the full path to the variant in format: [Page] | [Component Name] | [Variant Name].
  2. The programmer inserts the received data into the plugin field and presses the Find button.
  3. The plugin selects and focuses on the desired variant.
plugins.tagline: Easily find the right variant

plugins.name: Accessibility Simulator
plugins.description:
Explore and understand accessibility considerations in your designs through experimental simulations. This plugin offers three key features:


  1. Vision Simulator: Test how your designs appear to users with different visual conditions including cataracts, glaucoma, deuteranopia, and diabetic retinopathy.
  2. Motor Control Analysis: Evaluate interaction accessibility by analyzing target sizes and click difficulty based on standard guidelines.
  3. Cognitive Load Analysis: Assess visual complexity and text readability to optimize user comprehension.


How to use:

  1. Select any element in your design
  2. Choose a simulation type
  3. Review the analysis and suggested improvements
  4. Use insights as a starting point for further accessibility testing


Limitations:

  1. Simulations are approximate and may not perfectly reflect actual user experiences
  2. Should not replace professional accessibility audits
  3. Best used during the design process for early feedback and learning


Important note: This is an experimental tool intended for early-stage testing and learning. Results should not be used as a final assessment - always validate your designs with professional accessibility testing and real user feedback.
plugins.tagline: Vision simulation, Motor control analysis and Cognitive load analysis initial experimental simulator

plugins.name: Paper (Beta)
plugins.description:
The Paper plugin is a simple plugin designed to help users efficiently take and organize notes directly within their Figma files. Whether you're collaborating on a design project, documenting ideas, or adding context to your work, this plugin provides a seamless way to capture and manage your thoughts without leaving the Figma environment.


Key Features:


Heading Styles: Easily structure your notes with customizable heading styles, making it easy to organize your content.

Text Formatting: Use bold, italics, and other text formatting options to emphasize important information.

To-Do Lists: Stay on top of tasks with built-in to-do list functionality, helping you track progress and prioritize work.

Bulleted and Numbered Lists: Organize your notes with clean, easy-to-read lists for quick reference.

Privacy-Focused: All data remains within the plugin, ensuring that no information is sent outside your Figma file. Your notes are securely stored and only accessible to you and your collaborators.


Future updates will continue to expand on these features, offering even more tools to enhance your note-taking experience within Figma.


Perfect for designers, developers, and teams who need a flexible and private note-taking solution integrated directly into their design workflow!
plugins.tagline: A dead simple note taking plugin for figma

plugins.name: ThumbLayer – Layers with Thumbnail's Preview
plugins.description:
Streamline Your Figma Workflow with “ThumbLayer – Layers with Thumbnail's Preview” Plugin


Boost your design efficiency with “ThumbLayer – Layers with Thumbnail's Preview” — the ultimate Figma plugin for managing complex design layers effortlessly. This powerful tool offers a visual layer tree view with real-time thumbnail previews, making it easier than ever to organize, navigate, and control your Figma layers.


🚀 Key Features to Supercharge Your Design Process:


✅ Visual Layer Tree View

Easily view, organize, and manage your entire layer structure with an intuitive, collapsible tree interface.


✅ Layer Thumbnails Preview

Instantly see thumbnail previews of each layer for faster navigation and layer identification.


✅ Quick Layer Selection

Select and jump to any layer directly from the plugin, saving time and improving workflow speed.


✅ Visibility Toggle

Quickly show or hide layers with just one click, helping you focus on the elements that matter.


✅ Expand/Collapse All Layers

Simplify complex projects by expanding or collapsing all layer groups instantly.


⸻


🎯 Why Choose “Layers with Thumbnails”?

•Ideal for UI/UX designers, illustrators, and web designers working on complex Figma files.

•Perfect for organizing large design projects, managing nested layers, and improving design clarity.

•Speeds up layer selection and editing, enhancing productivity and design accuracy.

•Lightweight and intuitive, designed to integrate seamlessly with your Figma workflow.


Whether you’re managing intricate user interfaces, detailed illustrations, or multi-page design projects, “Layers with Thumbnails” simplifies your layer management, ensuring a more productive and organized design process.


⸻


🔍 Optimize Your Figma Workflow Today!

Download “Layers with Thumbnails” and take control of your Figma layers like never before!

accepted.name: Pawel
accepted.description: Product Designer, playing with JS. Figma plugin for generating NFTs.

plugins.name: CarouselCraft
plugins.description:
Diga adeus à criação manual de carrosséis! O CarouselCraft é o plugin definitivo para automatizar seu fluxo de trabalho no Figma, transformando dados JSON ou simples ideias em carrosséis completos e prontos para postar.


Passe menos tempo em tarefas repetitivas e mais tempo criando designs incríveis.


✨ Principais Funcionalidades


Criação via JSON: Cole uma estrutura de dados e veja o plugin montar carrosséis inteiros, com tema e textos, em um piscar de olhos.

Múltiplas Variações de Layout: Crie até 11 templates de design (`Cover-0`, `Content-0`, etc.) e teste diferentes estilos com facilidade.

Nomenclatura Inteligente: Seus frames são nomeados e organizados automaticamente, prontos para exportação.

Posicionamento Automático: O plugin alinha todos os slides e carrosséis perfeitamente na sua página.


---


🤖 Gere Conteúdo com IA (IA Craft)


Está sem ideias? Deixe nossa IA trabalhar por você! A funcionalidade IA Craft gera conteúdo para carrosséis completos com base em seus temas e público-alvo.


Plano Gratuito: Você pode gerar até 3 carrosséis usando a IA para testar todo o seu poder, a criação via Json é ilimitada

Plano Creator (R$ 12,90/mês): Gere carrosséis com IA de forma ilimitada e acelere sua produção de conteúdo como nunca antes.


---


🚀 Como Começar


1. Crie sua Conta: Para usar a automação e a IA, você precisa de um token de acesso. Crie sua conta gratuita em: https://carouselcraft.klotar.studio/

2. Prepare seus Templates: No Figma, crie seus frames com nomes numéricos (ex: `Cover-0`, `Content-0`, `End-0`).

3. Execute o Plugin: Abra o CarouselCraft, insira seu token, cole seu JSON ou use a aba "🤖 IA Craft".

4. Clique e Crie: Pronto! Seus carrosséis serão gerados instantaneamente.


O CarouselCraft é a ferramenta perfeita para social media, designers de UI/UX e criadores de conteúdo que buscam eficiência e consistência.
plugins.tagline: O fim do trabalho manual. Crie carrosséis perfeitos para Instagram em segundos.

plugins.name: Skew All
plugins.description:
You absolutely need this FREE tool!


With this plugin, you can skew any single element or group of elements in your design. (And yes, we mean ANYTHING! Even a Frame.


Select a layer or group of layers, then use the sliders to adjust the skew for both the horizontal and vertical axes. The skew is applied in real time and can be adjusted or removed anytime.

It’s that simple!


✨ Plugin Features

1. Real-time preview of adjustments

2. Clean and intuitive interface

3. Ability to skew multiple objects simultaneously

4. Free to use!

plugins.name: Catalyst MUI Plugin
plugins.description:
This plugin is specifically designed to streamline the workflow for teams utilizing a Design System built with MUI (Material UI) v6.1.0. Its primary function is to enable the seamless exportation of the Design System theme directly from Figma into a format compatible with Material UI-based projects.

Key Features:

  1. Theme Exportation: The plugin generates a JSON theme file containing all key design tokens and styles defined in the Figma Design System.
  2. Comprehensive Style Coverage: The exported JSON includes:
  3. Typography: Font families, weights, sizes, and line heights.
  4. Colors: Primary, secondary, and custom color palettes.
  5. Shapes: Border radii, component shapes, and other styling details.
  6. Spacing: Margins, paddings, and grid spacings.
  7. Breakpoints: Responsive design breakpoints for consistent behavior across devices.
  8. Component Styles: Custom styling for MUI components, ensuring pixel-perfect design fidelity.
  9. React App Integration: The JSON file can be directly imported into your MUI Material-based React application, enabling effortless theming and ensuring design-to-development consistency.
  10. Customization Made Easy: Developers can use the exported JSON as an overridden theme file in Material UI, allowing for easy customization and updates to the theme as the Design System evolves.

This plugin eliminates manual theme configuration, saving time and reducing errors, while ensuring that your Design System is accurately reflected in the final product. It’s a must-have tool for development teams aiming for seamless collaboration between design and code.
plugins.tagline: Catalyst MUI Plugin

plugins.name: Better Duplicate
plugins.description:
Duplicate selected frames to the right or downwards. Frames would be automatically arranged in a row or column based on their positions.


While iterating on a new design I felt a lot of friction from the native frame duplication process: it's hard to quickly duplicate frames and make sure they end up exactly where I want. Additionally, they can only be duplicated horizontally on canvas while I frequently add vertical iterations as well. Native duplication also doesn't work with multiple frames. To avoid needing to manually arrange frames while iterating quickly I created this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames right or down using smart algorithms for their placement

⚡️ What is Recontent.app?

Recontent helps product teams collaborate on localization & product copy. No more hardcoded keys, outdated text or misleading translations.

plugins.name: Align Screenshots
plugins.description:
選択したスクリーンショットを横一列に並べます。


使い方

1. スクリーンショットを複数選択します。

2. 1枚あたりのWidthと、スクリーンショット同士の余白を指定します。

3. 本プラグインを実行します。


------


This plugin arranges selected screenshots side by side in a horizontal row.


How to Use

1. Select multiple screenshots.

2. Specify the width for each screenshot and the margin between them.

3. Run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: The plugin lines up images with fixed width and spacing.

plugins.name: Color Code Extractor
plugins.description:
Color Code Extractor helps you identify and extract all color codes used in your selected Figma frames, making it easier to maintain design consistency and build design systems.


✨ FEATURES:


• Extract all color codes from selected frames, groups, or individual nodes


• View colors in a visual grid with hex codes for easy reference


• Copy any color code to clipboard with a single click


• Handles both fill and stroke colors automatically


• Supports opacity/alpha channel in color codes


• Works with multiple selections simultaneously


🎯 PERFECT FOR:


• Design system documentation


• Creating color palettes from existing designs


• Ensuring color consistency across projects


• Handoff to developers


• Auditing designs for color usage


Simply select any frame, group, or node in your design, run the plugin, and instantly see all colors used. No more manually inspecting elements or guessing which colors are being used where!


Color Code Extractor is lightweight, fast, and works entirely within Figma - no external services required.

plugins.tagline: Extract and copy all the color codes from your design with a single click

plugins.name: CTRL Var: Rename Variables
plugins.description:
Finally, CMD/CTRL + R for variables!

CTRL Var was built to give you many of the same renaming features available for layers - for variables.


Preview your changes

Easily view the variables in your collections, search results, and potential changes before updating.

  1. Scrollable list let's you see the full list and long path names.
  2. Change counts provided to help confirm the impact of the changes.


Search your variable tables

Use the search field to find variable names within a collection.

  1. Easily identify location, patterns, and inconsistencies.
  2. Search has no impact on changes - just a needed feature.


Set the scope of your name changes

Use the scope field to set a path to a specific group, which will limit changes to variables within it.

  1. Scoping must start from the beginning of the path to a group of variables.


Rename part of a variable's name

Use the match field to find a character or word to be replaced with something from the rename field.


Cut text before or after

Remove all text from before or after the matching text

Use the X → / X ← buttons or enter these short codes in the rename field:

  1. #!* (before)
  2. #*! (after).


Add incrementing numbers to your variables

Use the # ↑ / # ↓ buttons to enter ascending or descending numbers to matching variables names. You can also use these short codes in the rename field:

  1. #>> (ascending from top)
  2. #<< (descending to bottom)
  3. Use the number field to control which number to start or end with
  4. The number of < or > characters signifies the number of digits to be used. For example < is 1, << is 01, <<< is 001, etc.


Limitations

  1. Variables do not allow { } . $
  2. Variable names must be unique, no duplicates
  3. There is a chance the use of some special characters within your variables, such as # & < > * ! may have issues using certain short codes which contain those same characters.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Rename variables like layers, CTRL/CMD + R style!

plugins.name: Figiconizer - Auto-Resizes & Organizer Icons
plugins.description:
Figiconizer – Simplify Icon Organization in Figma!

Figiconizer is a handy plugin designed to help you quickly and efficiently organize icons in Figma. Whether you're working with individual icons or creating an entire icon set, Figiconizer automatically arranges your icons and resizes them to fit your desired dimensions.


How Does It Work?

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Run the Figiconizer plugin.
  3. Enter your preferred frame size and padding value.
  4. Figiconizer automatically arranges your icons proportionally within the frames.


Why Choose Figiconizer?

  1. Fast and Efficient: No more manually resizing icons one by one. Create a perfectly organized icon set in seconds.
  2. Customizable Settings: Set your own frame size and padding values to ensure your icons look exactly the way you want.
  3. Tidy Workspace: Keep your icons neatly organized, speeding up your design workflow.


Who Is It For?

  1. Designers creating icon sets.
  2. Anyone who wants a clean and consistent workspace in Figma.
  3. UX/UI designers looking to speed up their prototyping process.


With Figiconizer, organizing icons has never been easier! Try it now and save time on your Figma projects. 🍻🎉


☕️ Buy me a coffee
plugins.tagline: Figiconizer: Auto-resizes & organizer icons in Figma. Quick & easy!
